content.description: Start on sloping side pulls with cryptic feet. Try and hang on and stay tight to get to the opposing crimps of “Into Dust”.  Finish is the same.Somehow no matter how much you brush the side pulls the one start hold always feels slightly damp. Hence the name.

Amazing line! Well worth the hike for this climb alone Start on obvious holds. Make a hard gaston move to then work into a undercling. work through a criptic sequence to better finish holds. Best to have a spotter!I had red tagged this problem for some time. Doing ground up bouldering and trying to figure out the moves was getting old. I decided to bring my friend Jermey Williamson along from Birmingham one day. I didnt have the upper moves figured out so I decided to bring a rope up with me. 15 minutes after figuring out the beta Jeremy dispatched the FA flawlessly. A Christmas present from me.
content.location: Middle of the face on the Ripple Effect Boulder

content.description: Start on obvious holds. Move left and up. Use a drastic flag to gain two finger pinch then bump out to a good jug. Move your feet around the arete and find hidden holds further back.
content.location: Same start as Ripple Effect on left side of boulder

content.description: Start on opposing crimps and smearing feet. Bump left hand out to the left to good hold. Move feet up higher and go to small dish near the lip. Rock up and reach back to better holds.
Start on side pull and small pinch undercling with low feet. Pick your poison of going wide and to the right or bumping your left hands up first. utilize some heel hooks to help. Topout on good holds
content.location: Right bulge of ripple effect boulder. The large flake in the back is considered off for the v3 version

content.description: The main attraction to the area.    Ripple Effect goes straight up the main face.   There are good warmup problems on the boulder as well.
